editorialSummary.text: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.

originalText.text: Best service Iâ€™ve ever had. All the fresh veggies even at night. Thatâ€™s all we actually want from subway. Good and friendly staff.

text.text: Best service Iâ€™ve ever had. All the fresh veggies even at night. Thatâ€™s all we actually want from subway. Good and friendly staff.

originalText.text: Honestly, itâ€™s well known most subways are pretty stingy with the toppings. This place takes it to another level. They put less and less of everything as time goes by & the bread is usually stale. Also, if youâ€™re a fan of Sweet Onion sauce? This place no longer offers it. They have a sweet onion Teriyaki flavor (which is horrible). I wish the person wouldâ€™ve informed me of the change before I paid. I sat in the facility and tried it, but I couldnâ€™t even eat the sandwich (thatâ€™s how bad the sauce is). When I went back to ask if maybe there was a mistake and the wrong sauce was put, they just shrugged and said itâ€™s the new sauce they have to replace the other one. No refund. No replacement sandwich. Nothing.

originalText.text: The staff was very good. Friendly and Honest. I say honest because one day in October, unbeknownst to me, ðŸ˜® I carelessly left my debit card here! I called them up when I realized where I last had it and they verified days later that they still had possession of my card, with no fraud. I was very thankful for their safe keeping of my card. Then I had another delicious SUBWAY Sandwich the night I came to pick up my card!ðŸ˜‰

originalText.text: While ordering a sandwich, I noticed a young cockroach on the sandwich being prepared before mine. The woman preparing the sandwich noticed this and quietly removed it, but did not discard the contaminated food and did not change gloves. She then prepared my sandwich. I paid for it and promptly threw it away after leaving, as I did not want to cause a scene. This is disgusting, unsanitary, and speaks of further health issues at this Subway.

The woman preparing the sandwich noticed this and quietly removed it, but did not discard the contaminated food and did not change gloves. She then prepared my sandwich. I paid for it and promptly threw it away after leaving, as I did not want to cause a scene. This is disgusting, unsanitary, and speaks of further health issues at this Subway.

originalText.text:
I've been to that subway more than twice already. The first few times, the staff was rude. One time I asked a question while paying and the woman cashier was cutting me and didn't let me ask my question until I insisted that she listens to me. And today, I ordered a tuna sandwich and while paying I asked if what they were giving me was indeed the tuna sandwich, the cashier said yes and looked very bored. I then go back to my work place, open it and find what? A meatball sandwich. I go back and find the other man who they gave my sandwich to and we both asked for new sandwiches. The cashier started smiling to me a lot, what a coincidence..
Bottom line, the service is not good at all. They look like they want us to pay and just leave.. Not going back there any time soon.
